src.ayravainentuuli.util

Class TicTacToe

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.ayravainentuuli.util.TicTacToe

  • public class TicTacToe
extends java.lang.Object
    The class TicTacToe contains methods to execute the required functions for the game.

    • Method Detail

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        Prints current board status.

      • checkForWin

        public boolean checkForWin(java.lang.String currentPlayerMark,
                           int marksForWin)
        Returns boolean to determine whether the game is over. Calls different methods to check for a win on the x-axis, y-axis and both diagonals. The game ends if the method returns true.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayerMark - mark that is searched on the board
        marksForWin - the amount of marks needed for a win
        Returns:
        boolean value

      • computerMove

        public void computerMove(java.lang.String computerMark)
        Generates a random computer move using Math.random(). Randomizes new values for x and y coordinates until an empty spot on the board is found.
        Parameters:
        computerMark - computer's mark which place on the board is to be determined

      • changePlayerMark

        public java.lang.String changePlayerMark(java.lang.String currentPlayerMark)
        Returns changed String argument. If current player mark is " x " return " o ", otherwise return " x ".
        Parameters:
        currentPlayerMark - is to be changed
        Returns:
        changed String

      • placeMark

        public boolean placeMark(int x,
                         int y,
                         java.lang.String currentMark)
        Returns boolean value, depending on two arguments' int values. Checks if String can be placed on the given x- and y-coordinates. If the values represent an empty spot on the board, currentMark can be placed there and method returns false, otherwise true.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate value
        y - y-coordinate value
        currentMark - player's or computer's mark to be placed on the board
        Returns:
        boolean value
